trans-unit.source: (F) The CORE:: namespace is reserved for Perl keywords.
trans-unit.target: (F) El espacio de nombres CORE :: está reservado para palabras clave de Perl.

trans-unit.source: (F) The POD document being formatted had syntax errors and the errors option was set to die.
trans-unit.target: (F) El documento POD que se estaba formateando tenía errores de sintaxis y la opción de errors estaba configurada para die .

trans-unit.source: (F) The POD document being formatted had syntax errors and the errors option was set to die.

(F) The Perl parser has no idea what to do with the specified character in your Perl script (or eval) near the specified column. Perhaps you tried to run a compressed script, a binary program, or a directory as a Perl program.
trans-unit.target: (F) El analizador de Perl no tiene idea de qué hacer con el carácter especificado en su script Perl (o eval) cerca de la columna especificada. Quizás intentó ejecutar un script comprimido, un programa binario o un directorio como programa Perl.

trans-unit.source: (F) The XS module in question was compiled against a different incompatible version of Perl than the one that has loaded the XS module.
trans-unit.target: (F) El módulo XS en cuestión se compiló con una versión incompatible de Perl diferente a la que cargó el módulo XS.

trans-unit.source: (F) The \C character class used to allow a match of single byte within a multi-byte utf-8 character, but was removed in v5.24 as it broke encapsulation and its implementation was extremely buggy. If you really need to process the individual bytes, you probably want to convert your string to one where each underlying byte is stored as a character, with utf8::encode().
(F) The alias name passed to coloralias() matches a standard color name. Standard color names cannot be aliased.
trans-unit.target: (F) El nombre de alias pasado a coloralias () coincide con un nombre de color estándar. Los nombres de colores estándar no pueden tener alias.

trans-unit.source: (F) The anonymous subroutine you're trying to call hasn't been defined, or if it was, it has since been undefined.
trans-unit.target: (F) La subrutina anónima a la que intenta llamar no se ha definido, o si lo estaba, desde entonces no se ha definido.

trans-unit.source: (F) The argument to delete must be either a hash or array element, such as:
trans-unit.target: (F) El argumento a delete debe ser un elemento hash o de matriz, como:

trans-unit.source: (F) The argument to exists for exists &sub must be a subroutine name, and not a subroutine call. exists &sub() will generate this error.
trans-unit.target: (F) El argumento para exists para exists &sub debe ser un nombre de subrutina y no una llamada de subrutina. exists &sub() generará este error.

trans-unit.source: (F) The argument to exists must be a hash or array element or a subroutine with an ampersand, such as:
trans-unit.target: (F) El argumento para exists debe ser un elemento hash o de matriz o una subrutina con un ampersand, como:

trans-unit.source: (F) The argument to delete must be either a hash or array element, such as:
(F) The argument to exists for exists &sub must be a subroutine name, and not a subroutine call. exists &sub() will generate this error.
(F) The argument to exists must be a hash or array element or a subroutine with an ampersand, such as:
(F) The argument to a '.' in your template tried to move the working position to before the start of the packed string being built.
trans-unit.target: (F) El argumento de un '.' en su plantilla intentó mover la posición de trabajo a antes del inicio de la construcción de la cadena empaquetada.

trans-unit.source: (F) The argument to the indicated command line switch must follow immediately after the switch, without intervening spaces.
trans-unit.target: (F) El argumento del cambio de línea de comando indicado debe seguir inmediatamente después del cambio, sin espacios intermedios.

trans-unit.source: (F) The bareword form of require has been invoked with a filename which could not have been generated by a valid bareword permitted by the parser. You shouldn't be able to get this error from Perl code, but XS code may throw it if it passes an invalid module name to Perl_load_module.

(F) The brackets around a character class must match. If you wish to include a closing bracket in a character class, backslash it or put it first. The <-- HERE shows whereabouts in the regular expression the problem was discovered. See perlre.
trans-unit.target: (F) Los corchetes alrededor de una clase de carácter deben coincidir. Si deseas incluir un corchete de cierre en una clase de personaje, haz una barra invertida o colócalo primero. <- AQUÍ muestra el paradero en la expresión regular donde se descubrió el problema. Ver perlre .

trans-unit.source: (F) The capture group you specified can't possibly exist because the number you used is not within the legal range of possible values for this machine.
(F) The character constant represented by ... is not a valid hexadecimal number. Either it is empty, or you tried to use a character other than 0 - 9 or A - F, a - f in a hexadecimal number.
trans-unit.target: (F) La constante de carácter representada por ... no es un número hexadecimal válido. O está vacío o ha intentado utilizar un carácter que no sea 0 - 9 o A - F, a - f en un número hexadecimal.

trans-unit.source: (F) The charnames handler returned malformed UTF-8.
trans-unit.target: (F) El controlador de nombres de caracteres devolvió UTF-8 con formato incorrecto.

trans-unit.source: (F) The class in the character class [: :] syntax is unknown. The <-- HERE shows whereabouts in the regular expression the problem was discovered. Note that the POSIX character classes do not have the is prefix the corresponding C interfaces have: in other words, it's [[:print:]], not isprint . See perlre.
trans-unit.target: (F) La clase en la sintaxis de la clase de caracteres [::] es desconocida. <- AQUÍ muestra el paradero en la expresión regular donde se descubrió el problema. Tenga en cuenta que las clases de caracteres POSIX no tienen el prefijo is que tienen las interfaces C correspondientes: en otras palabras, es [[:print:]] , no isprint . Ver perlre .

trans-unit.source: (F) The class in the character class [: :] syntax is unknown. The <-- HERE shows whereabouts in the regular expression the problem was discovered. Note that the POSIX character classes do not have the is prefix the corresponding C interfaces have: in other words, it's [[:print:]], not isprint. See perlre.

(F) The code you are trying to run claims it will not run on the version of Perl you are using because it is too new. Maybe the code needs to be updated, or maybe it is simply wrong and the version check should just be removed.
trans-unit.target: (F) El código que está intentando ejecutar afirma que no se ejecutará en la versión de Perl que está utilizando porque es demasiado nuevo. Tal vez sea necesario actualizar el código, o tal vez simplemente sea incorrecto y la verificación de la versión debería eliminarse.

trans-unit.source: (F) The code you are trying to run has asked for a newer version of Perl than you are running. Perhaps use 5.10 was written instead of use 5.010 or use v5.10 . Without the leading v , the number is interpreted as a decimal, with every three digits after the decimal point representing a part of the version number. So 5.10 is equivalent to v5.100.
trans-unit.target: (F) El código que está intentando ejecutar ha solicitado una versión de Perl más nueva de la que está ejecutando. Quizás use 5.10 fue escrito en lugar de use 5.010 o use v5.10 . Sin la v inicial , el número se interpreta como un decimal, y cada tres dígitos después del punto decimal representa una parte del número de versión. Entonces 5.10 es equivalente a v5.100.

trans-unit.source: (F) The code you are trying to run has asked for a newer version of Perl than you are running. Perhaps use 5.10 was written instead of use 5.010 or use v5.10. Without the leading v, the number is interpreted as a decimal, with every three digits after the decimal point representing a part of the version number. So 5.10 is equivalent to v5.100.

(F) The compiler tried to interpret a bracketed expression as a subscript. But to the left of the brackets was an expression that didn't look like a hash or array reference, or anything else subscriptable.
trans-unit.target: (F) El compilador intentó interpretar una expresión entre corchetes como un subíndice. Pero a la izquierda de los corchetes había una expresión que no parecía un hash o una referencia de matriz, o cualquier otra cosa con subíndice.

trans-unit.source: (F) The condition part of a (?(condition)if-clause|else-clause) construct is not known. The condition must be one of the following:
trans-unit.target: (F) No se conoce la parte de condición de una construcción (? (Condición) cláusula-if | cláusula-else). La condición debe ser una de las siguientes:

trans-unit.source: (F) The construction my $x := 42 used to parse as equivalent to my $x : = 42 (applying an empty attribute list to $x ). This construct was deprecated in 5.12.0, and has now been made a syntax error, so := can be reclaimed as a new operator in the future.
trans-unit.target: (F) La construcción que my $x := 42 solía analizar como equivalente a my $x : = 42 (aplicando una lista de atributos vacía a $x ). Esta construcción quedó en desuso en 5.12.0 y ahora se ha convertido en un error de sintaxis, por lo que := se puede reclamar como un nuevo operador en el futuro.

trans-unit.source: (F) The construction my $x := 42 used to parse as equivalent to my $x : = 42 (applying an empty attribute list to $x). This construct was deprecated in 5.12.0, and has now been made a syntax error, so := can be reclaimed as a new operator in the future.

(F) The contents of a <> operator may not exceed the maximum size of a Perl identifier. If you're just trying to glob a long list of filenames, try using the glob() operator, or put the filenames into a variable and glob that.
trans-unit.target: (F) El contenido de un operador <> no puede exceder el tamaño máximo de un identificador Perl. Si solo está tratando de agrupar una lista larga de nombres de archivo, intente usar el operador glob (), o coloque los nombres de archivo en una variable y glob eso.

trans-unit.source: (F) The count in the (un)pack template may be replaced by [TEMPLATE] only if TEMPLATE always matches the same amount of packed bytes that can be determined from the template alone. This is not possible if it contains any of the codes @, /, U, u, w or a *-length. Redesign the template.
trans-unit.target: (F) El recuento en la plantilla de (des) paquete puede ser reemplazado por [TEMPLATE] solo si TEMPLATE siempre coincide con la misma cantidad de bytes empaquetados que se puede determinar solo a partir de la plantilla. Esto no es posible si contiene alguno de los códigos @, /, U, u, w o una longitud *. Rediseña la plantilla.

trans-unit.source: (F) The currently executing code was compiled with the -d switch, but for some reason the current debugger (e.g.
trans-unit.target: (F) El código que se está ejecutando actualmente se compiló con la opción -d , pero por alguna razón el depurador actual (p. Ej.

trans-unit.source: (F) The deeply magical "goto subroutine" call can only replace one subroutine call for another. It can't manufacture one out of whole cloth. In general you should be calling it out of only an AUTOLOAD routine anyway. See goto.
trans-unit.target: (F) La llamada "goto subrutina" profundamente mágica sólo puede reemplazar una llamada de subrutina por otra. No puede fabricar uno con tela entera. En general, debería llamarlo solo desde una rutina AUTOLOAD de todos modos. Ver goto .

trans-unit.source: (F) The deeply magical "goto subroutine" call can only replace one subroutine call for another. It can't manufacture one out of whole cloth. In general you should be calling it out of only an AUTOLOAD routine anyway. See "goto" in perlfunc.
(F) The end of the perl code contained within the {...} must be followed immediately by a ')'.
trans-unit.target: (F) El final del código Perl contenido dentro de {...} debe ir seguido inmediatamente por un ')'.

trans-unit.source: (F) The failing code attempted to delete a key whose value has been declared readonly from a restricted hash.
trans-unit.target: (F) El código fallido intentó eliminar una clave cuyo valor ha sido declarado de solo lectura desde un hash restringido.

trans-unit.source: (F) The failing code attempted to delete from a restricted hash a key which is not in its key set.
trans-unit.target: (F) El código fallido intentó eliminar de un hash restringido una clave que no está en su conjunto de claves.

trans-unit.source: (F) The failing code has attempted to get or set a key which is not in the current set of allowed keys of a restricted hash.
trans-unit.target: (F) El código que falla ha intentado obtener o establecer una clave que no está en el conjunto actual de claves permitidas de un hash restringido.

trans-unit.source: (F) The final summary message when a perl -c fails.
trans-unit.target: (F) El mensaje de resumen final cuando falla un perl -c .

trans-unit.source: (F) The final summary message when a perl -c succeeds.
trans-unit.target: (F) El mensaje de resumen final cuando un perl -c tiene éxito.

trans-unit.source: (F) The final summary message when a Perl compilation fails.
trans-unit.target: (F) El mensaje de resumen final cuando falla una compilación de Perl.

trans-unit.source: (F) The first argument to formline must be a valid format picture specification. It was found to be empty, which probably means you supplied it an uninitialized value. See perlform.
trans-unit.target: (F) El primer argumento de formline debe ser una especificación de imagen de formato válida. Se encontró que estaba vacío, lo que probablemente significa que le proporcionó un valor no inicializado. Ver perlform .

trans-unit.source: (F) The first time the %! hash is used, perl automatically loads the Errno.pm module. The Errno module is expected to tie the %! hash to provide symbolic names for $! errno values.
trans-unit.target: (F) La primera vez que el %! se utiliza hash, perl carga automáticamente el módulo Errno.pm. Se espera que el módulo Errno empate el%! hash para proporcionar nombres simbólicos para $! valores errno.

trans-unit.source: (F) The format indicated doesn't seem to exist. Perhaps it's really in another package? See perlform.
trans-unit.target: (F) El formato indicado no parece existir. ¿Quizás está realmente en otro paquete? Ver perlform .

trans-unit.source: (F) The function indicated isn't implemented on this architecture, according to the probings of Configure.
trans-unit.target: (F) La función indicada no está implementada en esta arquitectura, de acuerdo con los sondeos de Configure.

trans-unit.source: (F) The function requires fewer arguments than you specified.
trans-unit.target: (F) La función requiere menos argumentos de los que especificó.

trans-unit.source: (F) The function requires more arguments than you specified.
trans-unit.target: (F) La función requiere más argumentos de los que especificó.

trans-unit.source: (F) The given character is not a valid pack or unpack type. See pack.
trans-unit.target: (F) El carácter dado no es un tipo de paquete o desempaque válido. Ver paquete .

trans-unit.source: (F) The given character is not a valid pack or unpack type. See "pack" in perlfunc.

(F) The global variables $a and $b are reserved for sort comparisons. You mentioned $a or $b in the same line as the <=> or cmp operator, and the variable had earlier been declared as a lexical variable. Either qualify the sort variable with the package name, or rename the lexical variable.
trans-unit.target: (F) Las variables globales $ ay $ b están reservadas para comparaciones de ordenación. Mencionaste $ a o $ b en la misma línea que el operador <=> o cmp, y la variable había sido declarada anteriormente como una variable léxica. Califique la variable de clasificación con el nombre del paquete o cambie el nombre de la variable léxica.

trans-unit.source: (F) The indexes and widths specified in the format string of printf() or sprintf() are too large. The numbers must not overflow the size of integers for your architecture.
trans-unit.target: (F) Los índices y anchos especificados en la cadena de formato de printf() o sprintf() son demasiado grandes. Los números no deben exceder el tamaño de los enteros para su arquitectura.

trans-unit.source: (F) The indexes and widths specified in the format string of printf() or sprintf() are too large. The numbers must not overflow the size of integers for your architecture.
(F) The indicated attribute for a subroutine or variable was not recognized by Perl or by a user-supplied handler. See attributes.
trans-unit.target: (F) El atributo indicado para una subrutina o variable no fue reconocido por Perl o por un controlador proporcionado por el usuario. Ver atributos .

trans-unit.source: (F) The indicated attributes for a subroutine or variable were not recognized by Perl or by a user-supplied handler. See attributes.
trans-unit.target: (F) Los atributos indicados para una subrutina o variable no fueron reconocidos por Perl o por un controlador proporcionado por el usuario. Ver atributos .

trans-unit.source: (F) The internal routine that does method lookup was handed a symbol table that doesn't have a name. Symbol tables can become anonymous for example by undefining stashes: undef %Some::Package:: .
trans-unit.target: (F) La rutina interna que busca métodos recibió una tabla de símbolos que no tiene nombre. Las tablas de símbolos pueden volverse anónimas, por ejemplo, al no definir los escondites: undef %Some::Package:: .

trans-unit.source: (F) The internal routine that does method lookup was handed a symbol table that doesn't have a name. Symbol tables can become anonymous for example by undefining stashes: undef %Some::Package::.
(F) The internal structure of the version object was invalid. Perhaps the internals were modified directly in some way or an arbitrary reference was blessed into the "version" class.
trans-unit.target: (F) La estructura interna del objeto de versión no era válida. Quizás las partes internas se modificaron directamente de alguna manera o se bendijo una referencia arbitraria en la clase "versión".

trans-unit.source: (F) The length count obtained from a length/code unpack operation was negative. See pack.
trans-unit.target: (F) El recuento de longitudes obtenido de una operación de desembalaje de longitudes / códigos fue negativo. Ver paquete .

trans-unit.source: (F) The length count obtained from a length/code unpack operation was negative. See "pack" in perlfunc.
(F) The length of the result of a numeric format supplied to sprintf() or printf() would have been too large for the underlying C function to report. This limit is typically 2GB.
(F) The lexer couldn't find the final delimiter of a // or m{} construct. Remember that bracketing delimiters count nesting level. Missing the leading $ from a variable $m may cause this error.
trans-unit.target: (F) El lexer no pudo encontrar el delimitador final de una construcción // o m {}. Recuerde que los delimitadores entre corchetes cuentan el nivel de anidamiento. La falta del $ inicial de una variable $m puede causar este error.

trans-unit.source: (F) The lexer couldn't find the final delimiter of a tr///, tr[][], y/// or y[][] construct.
trans-unit.target: (F) El lexer no pudo encontrar el delimitador final de una construcción tr ///, tr [] [], y /// o y [] [].

trans-unit.source: (F) The lexer couldn't find the final delimiter of an s/// or s{}{} construct. Remember that bracketing delimiters count nesting level. Missing the leading $ from variable $s may cause this error.
trans-unit.target: (F) El lexer no pudo encontrar el delimitador final de una construcción s /// o s {} {}. Recuerde que los delimitadores entre corchetes cuentan el nivel de anidamiento. La falta del $ inicial de la variable $s puede causar este error.

trans-unit.source: (F) The lexer couldn't find the interior delimiter of a tr/// or tr[][] or y/// or y[][] construct. Missing the leading $ from variables $tr or $y may cause this error.
trans-unit.target: (F) El lexer no pudo encontrar el delimitador interior de una construcción tr /// o tr [] [] o y /// o y [] []. La falta del $ inicial de las variables $tr o $y puede causar este error.

trans-unit.source: (F) The lexer couldn't find the interior delimiter of an s/// or s{}{} construct. Remember that bracketing delimiters count nesting level. Missing the leading $ from variable $s may cause this error.
trans-unit.target: (F) El lexer no pudo encontrar el delimitador interior de una construcción s /// o s {} {}. Recuerde que los delimitadores entre corchetes cuentan el nivel de anidamiento. La falta del $ inicial de la variable $s puede causar este error.

trans-unit.source: (F) The lexer counted more closing curly or square brackets than opening ones, so you're probably missing a matching opening bracket. As a general rule, you'll find the missing one (so to speak) near the place you were last editing.
trans-unit.target: (F) El lexer contó más corchetes de cierre o corchetes que de apertura, por lo que probablemente le falte un corchete de apertura correspondiente. Como regla general, encontrarás el que falta (por así decirlo) cerca del lugar donde editaste por última vez.

trans-unit.source: (F) The lexer counted more opening curly or square brackets than closing ones. As a general rule, you'll find it's missing near the place you were last editing.
trans-unit.target: (F) El lexer contó más corchetes o corchetes de apertura que de cierre. Como regla general, encontrará que falta cerca del lugar donde estuvo editando por última vez.

trans-unit.source: (F) The lexer found something other than a simple identifier at the start of an attribute, and it wasn't a semicolon or the start of a block. Perhaps you terminated the parameter list of the previous attribute too soon. See attributes.
trans-unit.target: (F) El lexer encontró algo más que un identificador simple al comienzo de un atributo, y no era un punto y coma o el comienzo de un bloque. Quizás terminó la lista de parámetros del atributo anterior demasiado pronto. Ver atributos .

trans-unit.source: (F) The lexer saw a left angle bracket in a place where it was expecting a term, so it's looking for the corresponding right angle bracket, and not finding it. Chances are you left some needed parentheses out earlier in the line, and you really meant a "less than".
trans-unit.target: (F) El lexer vio un corchete de ángulo izquierdo en un lugar donde esperaba un término, por lo que está buscando el corchete de ángulo recto correspondiente y no lo encuentra. Lo más probable es que dejaste algunos paréntesis necesarios al principio de la línea y realmente quisiste decir "menos que".

trans-unit.source: (F) The lexer saw an opening (left) parenthesis character while parsing an attribute list, but the matching closing (right) parenthesis character was not found. You may need to add (or remove) a backslash character to get your parentheses to balance. See attributes.
trans-unit.target: (F) El lexer vio un carácter de paréntesis de apertura (izquierda) mientras analizaba una lista de atributos, pero no se encontró el carácter de paréntesis de cierre (derecho) correspondiente. Es posible que deba agregar (o eliminar) un carácter de barra invertida para equilibrar los paréntesis. Ver atributos .

trans-unit.source: (F) The malloc() function returned 0, indicating there was insufficient remaining memory (or virtual memory) to satisfy the request. However, the request was judged large enough (compile-time default is 64K), so a possibility to shut down by trapping this error is granted.
trans-unit.target: (F) La función malloc () devolvió 0, lo que indica que no quedaba suficiente memoria (o memoria virtual) para satisfacer la solicitud. Sin embargo, la solicitud se consideró lo suficientemente grande (el tiempo de compilación predeterminado es 64K), por lo que se otorga la posibilidad de cerrar mediante la captura de este error.

trans-unit.source: (F) The method resolution order (MRO) of the given class is not C3-consistent, and you have enabled the C3 MRO for this class. See the C3 documentation in mro for more information.
trans-unit.target: (F) El orden de resolución del método (MRO) de la clase dada no es consistente con C3, y usted ha habilitado el MRO C3 para esta clase. Consulte la documentación de C3 en mro para obtener más información.

trans-unit.source: (F) The method which overloads "=" is buggy. See "Copy Constructor" in overload.
(F) The method which overloads "=" is buggy. See Copy Constructor in overload.
trans-unit.target: (F) El método que sobrecarga "=" tiene errores. Consulte Copiar constructor en sobrecarga .

trans-unit.source: (F) The modifiers '!', '<' and '>' are allowed in pack() or unpack() only after certain types. See pack.
trans-unit.target: (F) Los modificadores '!', '<' Y '>' están permitidos en pack () o unpack () solo después de ciertos tipos. Ver paquete .

trans-unit.source: (F) The modifiers '!', '<' and '>' are allowed in pack() or unpack() only after certain types. See "pack" in perlfunc.

(F) The module argument to perl's -m and -M command-line options cannot contain single colons in the module name, but only in the arguments after "=". In other words, -MFoo::Bar=:baz is ok, but -MFoo:Bar=baz is not.
trans-unit.target: (F) El argumento módulo para Perl -m y -M opciones de línea de comandos no puede contener dos puntos individuales en el nombre del módulo, pero sólo en los argumentos después de "=". En otras palabras, -MFoo :: Bar =: baz está bien, pero -MFoo: Bar = baz no.

trans-unit.source: (F) The module in question uses features of a version of Perl more recent than the currently running version. How long has it been since you upgraded, anyway? See require.
trans-unit.target: (F) El módulo en cuestión usa características de una versión de Perl más reciente que la versión actual. ¿Cuánto tiempo ha pasado desde que se actualizó, de todos modos? Ver require .

trans-unit.source: (F) The module in question uses features of a version of Perl more recent than the currently running version. How long has it been since you upgraded, anyway? See "require" in perlfunc.
(F) The module you loaded is trying to load an external library, like for example,
trans-unit.target: (F) El módulo que cargó está intentando cargar una biblioteca externa, como por ejemplo,

trans-unit.source: (F) The module you tried to load failed to load a dynamic extension. This may either mean that you upgraded your version of perl to one that is incompatible with your old dynamic extensions (which is known to happen between major versions of perl), or (more likely) that your dynamic extension was built against an older version of the library that is installed on your system. You may need to rebuild your old dynamic extensions.
trans-unit.target: (F) El módulo que intentó cargar no pudo cargar una extensión dinámica. Esto puede significar que actualizó su versión de perl a una que es incompatible con sus antiguas extensiones dinámicas (lo que se sabe que ocurre entre las versiones principales de perl), o (más probable) que su extensión dinámica se creó con una versión anterior de la biblioteca que está instalada en su sistema. Es posible que deba reconstruir sus antiguas extensiones dinámicas.

trans-unit.source: (F) The name you used inside \N{} is unknown to Perl. Check the spelling. You can say use charnames ":loose" to not have to be so precise about spaces, hyphens, and capitalization on standard Unicode names. (Any custom aliases that have been created must be specified exactly, regardless of whether :loose is used or not.) This error may also happen if the \N{} is not in the scope of the corresponding use charnames .
trans-unit.target: (F) El nombre que usó dentro de \N{} es desconocido para Perl. Revisar la ortografía. Puede decir use charnames ":loose" para no tener que ser tan preciso con los espacios, guiones y mayúsculas en los nombres Unicode estándar. (Cualquier alias personalizado que se haya creado debe especificarse exactamente, independientemente de si :loose se usa o no). Este error también puede ocurrir si \N{} no está en el alcance de los use charnames uso correspondientes .

trans-unit.source: (F) The name you used inside \N{} is unknown to Perl. Check the spelling. You can say use charnames ":loose" to not have to be so precise about spaces, hyphens, and capitalization on standard Unicode names. (Any custom aliases that have been created must be specified exactly, regardless of whether :loose is used or not.) This error may also happen if the \N{} is not in the scope of the corresponding use charnames.

(F) The named property which you specified via \p or \P is not one known to Perl. Perhaps you misspelled the name? See "Properties accessible through \p{} and \P{}" in perluniprops for a complete list of available official properties. If it is a user-defined property it must have been defined by the time the regular expression is matched.

(F) The named property which you specified via \p or \P is not one known to Perl. Perhaps you misspelled the name? See Properties accessible through \p{} and \P{} in perluniprops for a complete list of available official properties. If it is a user-defined property it must have been defined by the time the regular expression is compiled.
trans-unit.target: (F) La propiedad nombrada que especificó mediante \p o \P no es conocida por Perl. ¿Quizás escribiste mal el nombre? Consulte Propiedades accesibles a través de \ p {} y \ P {} en perluniprops para obtener una lista completa de las propiedades oficiales disponibles. Si es una propiedad definida por el usuario , debe haber sido definida en el momento en que se compila la expresión regular.

trans-unit.source: (F) The new (as of Perl 5.12) meaning of \N as [^\n] is not valid in a bracketed character class, for the same reason that . in a character class loses its specialness: it matches almost everything, which is probably not what you want.
trans-unit.target: (F) El nuevo significado (a partir de Perl 5.12) de \N como [^\n] no es válido en una clase de caracteres entre corchetes, por la misma razón que . en una clase de carácter pierde su especialidad: coincide con casi todo, que probablemente no sea lo que desea.

trans-unit.source: (F) The number of bits in vec() (the third argument) must be a power of two from 1 to 32 (or 64, if your platform supports that).
trans-unit.target: (F) El número de bits en vec () (el tercer argumento) debe ser una potencia de dos de 1 a 32 (o 64, si su plataforma lo admite).

trans-unit.source: (F) The only numeric variable which is allowed to start with a 0 is $0, and you mentioned a variable that starts with 0 that has more than one digit. You probably want to remove the leading 0, or if the intent was to express a variable name in octal you should convert to decimal.
(F) The parser found a line starting with <<<<<<<, >>>>>>>, or =======. These may be left by a version control system to mark conflicts after a failed merge operation.

(F) The parser found inconsistencies either while attempting to define an overloaded constant, or when trying to find the character name specified in the \N{...} escape. Perhaps you forgot to load the corresponding overload pragma?
trans-unit.target: (F) El analizador encontró inconsistencias al intentar definir una constante sobrecargada o al intentar encontrar el nombre del carácter especificado en el escape \N{...} . ¿Quizás olvidó cargar el pragma de sobrecarga correspondiente ?

trans-unit.source: (F) The parser found inconsistencies while attempting to define an overloaded constant. Perhaps you forgot to load the corresponding overload pragma?
trans-unit.target: (F) El analizador encontró inconsistencias al intentar definir una constante sobrecargada. ¿Quizás olvidó cargar el pragma de sobrecarga correspondiente ?

trans-unit.source: (F) The parser has given up trying to parse the program after 10 errors. Further error messages would likely be uninformative.
trans-unit.target: (F) El analizador ha dejado de intentar analizar el programa después de 10 errores. Es probable que otros mensajes de error no sean informativos.

trans-unit.source: (F) The pattern looks like a {min,max} quantifier, but the min or max could not be parsed as a valid number - either it has leading zeroes, or it represents too big a number to cope with. The <-- HERE shows where in the regular expression the problem was discovered. See perlre.
trans-unit.target: (F) El patrón parece un cuantificador {min, max}, pero el mínimo o el máximo no pueden ser analizados como un número válido, o tiene ceros a la izquierda o representa un número demasiado grande para manejarlo. <- AQUÍ muestra en qué parte de la expresión regular se descubrió el problema. Ver perlre .

trans-unit.source: (F) The pattern you've specified might cause the regular expression to infinite loop so it is forbidden. The <-- HERE shows whereabouts in the regular expression the problem was discovered. See perlre.
(F) The quote specification given (the quotes option to the constructor) was invalid. A quote specification must be either one character long or an even number (greater than one) characters long.
(F) The quote specification given (the quotes option to the constructor) was invalid. A quote specification must be one, two, or four characters long.
trans-unit.target: (F) La especificación de cotización dada (la opción de quotes para el constructor) no era válida. Una especificación de cotización debe tener uno, dos o cuatro caracteres.

trans-unit.source: (F) The range specified in a character class had a minimum character greater than the maximum character. One possibility is that you forgot the {} from your ending \x{} - \x without the curly braces can go only up to ff . The <-- HERE shows whereabouts in the regular expression the problem was discovered. See perlre.
trans-unit.target: (F) El rango especificado en una clase de carácter tenía un carácter mínimo mayor que el carácter máximo. Una posibilidad es que haya olvidado el {} de su terminación \x{} - \x sin las llaves puede ir solo hasta ff . <- AQUÍ muestra el paradero en la expresión regular donde se descubrió el problema. Ver perlre .

trans-unit.source: (F) The range specified in a character class had a minimum character greater than the maximum character. One possibility is that you forgot the {} from your ending \x{} - \x without the curly braces can go only up to ff. The <-- HERE shows whereabouts in the regular expression the problem was discovered. See perlre.
(F) The range specified in the tr/// or y/// operator had a minimum character greater than the maximum character. See perlop.
trans-unit.target: (F) El rango especificado en el operador tr /// o y /// tenía un carácter mínimo mayor que el carácter máximo. Ver perlop .

trans-unit.source: (F) The regular expression ends with an unbackslashed backslash. Backslash it. See perlre.
trans-unit.target: (F) La expresión regular termina con una barra invertida sin barra invertida. Barra invertida. Ver perlre .

trans-unit.source: (F) The regular expression expects a mandatory argument following the escape sequence and this has been omitted or incorrectly written.
trans-unit.target: (F) La expresión regular espera un argumento obligatorio después de la secuencia de escape y esto se ha omitido o escrito incorrectamente.

trans-unit.source: (F) The regular expression pattern had more than one of these mutually exclusive modifiers. Retain only the modifier that is supposed to be there.
trans-unit.target: (F) El patrón de expresión regular tenía más de uno de estos modificadores mutuamente excluyentes. Conserve solo el modificador que se supone que debe estar allí.

trans-unit.source: (F) The regular expression pattern had too many occurrences of the specified modifier. Remove the extraneous ones.
trans-unit.target: (F) El patrón de expresión regular tenía demasiadas apariciones del modificador especificado. Retire los extraños.

trans-unit.source: (F) The rename done by the -i switch failed for some reason, probably because you don't have write permission to the directory.
(F) The return statement was executed in mainline code, that is, where there was no subroutine call to return out of. See perlsub.
trans-unit.target: (F) La declaración de retorno se ejecutó en el código de la línea principal, es decir, donde no había ninguna llamada de subrutina para salir. Ver perlsub .

trans-unit.source: (F) The script run under suidperl was somehow illegal.
trans-unit.target: (F) El script ejecutado bajo suidperl era ilegal de alguna manera.

trans-unit.source: (F) The script you specified can't be opened for the indicated reason.
trans-unit.target: (F) El script que especificó no se puede abrir por el motivo indicado.

trans-unit.source: (F) The second argument of 3-argument open() is not among the list of valid modes: < , >, >> , +< , +>, +>> , -|, |-, <& , >&.
trans-unit.target: (F) El segundo argumento de open () de 3 argumentos no está entre la lista de modos válidos: < , > , >> , +< , +> , +>> , -| , |- , <& , >& .

trans-unit.source: (F) The second argument of 3-argument open() is not among the list of valid modes: <, >, >>, +<, +>, +>>, -|, |-, <&, >&.
(F) The second listed construct is no longer legal. Use the first one instead.
trans-unit.target: (F) El segundo constructo enumerado ya no es legal. Utilice el primero en su lugar.

trans-unit.source: (F) The simple rule to remember, if you want to match a literal "{" character (U+007B LEFT CURLY BRACKET) in a regular expression pattern, is to escape each literal instance of it in some way. Generally easiest is to precede it with a backslash, like "\{" or enclose it in square brackets ("[{]"). If the pattern delimiters are also braces, any matching right brace ("}") should also be escaped to avoid confusing the parser, for example,
(F) The sort comparison routine specified doesn't seem to exist. Perhaps it's in a different package? See sort.
trans-unit.target: (F) La rutina de comparación de clasificación especificada no parece existir. ¿Quizás esté en un paquete diferente? Ver ordenar .

trans-unit.source: (F) The sort comparison routine specified doesn't seem to exist. Perhaps it's in a different package? See "sort" in perlfunc.
(F) The sort comparison routine specified is declared but doesn't seem to have been defined yet. See sort.
trans-unit.target: (F) La rutina de comparación de ordenación especificada está declarada, pero parece que aún no se ha definido. Ver ordenar .

trans-unit.source: (F) The sort comparison routine specified is declared but doesn't seem to have been defined yet. See "sort" in perlfunc.
(F) The special variable $#, deprecated in older perls, was removed as of 5.10.0, is no longer supported and is a fatal error as of Perl 5.30. You should use the printf/sprintf functions instead.

(F) The special variable $*, deprecated in older perls, was removed in 5.10.0, is no longer supported and is a fatal error as of Perl 5.30. In previous versions of perl the use of $* enabled or disabled multi-line matching within a string.
(F) The special variable ${^ENCODING}, formerly used to implement the encoding pragma, is no longer supported as of Perl 5.26.0.

(F) The subroutine in question in the CORE package requires its argument to be a hard reference to data of the specified type. Overloading is ignored, so a reference to an object that is not the specified type, but nonetheless has overloading to handle it, will still not be accepted.
trans-unit.target: (F) La subrutina en cuestión en el paquete CORE requiere que su argumento sea una referencia estricta a datos del tipo especificado. La sobrecarga se ignora, por lo que una referencia a un objeto que no es del tipo especificado, pero que, sin embargo, tiene una sobrecarga para manejarlo, no será aceptada.

trans-unit.source: (F) The subroutine indicated hasn't been defined, or if it was, it has since been undefined.
trans-unit.target: (F) La subrutina indicada no se ha definido, o si lo estaba, desde entonces no se ha definido.

trans-unit.source: (F) The subroutine registered to handle constant overloading (see overload) or a custom charnames handler (see "CUSTOM TRANSLATORS" in charnames) returned an undefined value.
(F) The subroutine registered to handle constant overloading (see overload) or a custom charnames handler (see CUSTOM TRANSLATORS in charnames) returned an undefined value.
trans-unit.target: (F) La subrutina registrada para manejar la sobrecarga constante (ver sobrecarga ) o un controlador de nombres de caracteres personalizado (ver TRADUCTORES PERSONALIZADOS en nombres de caracteres ) devolvió un valor indefinido.

trans-unit.source: (F) The syntax for lexically scoped subroutines requires that they have a name with which they can be found.
trans-unit.target: (F) La sintaxis de las subrutinas de ámbito léxico requiere que tengan un nombre con el que se puedan encontrar.

trans-unit.source: (F) The sysread(), recv(), syswrite() and send() operators are not allowed on handles that have the :utf8 layer, either explicitly, or implicitly, eg., with the :encoding(UTF-16LE) layer.
(F) The target of a msgrcv must be modifiable to be used as a receive buffer.
trans-unit.target: (F) El destino de un msgrcv debe poder modificarse para usarse como búfer de recepción.

trans-unit.source: (F) The two-character sequence "(*" in this context in a regular expression pattern should be an indivisible token, with nothing intervening between the "(" and the "*" , but you separated them.
trans-unit.target: (F) La secuencia de dos caracteres "(*" en este contexto en un patrón de expresión regular debe ser un símbolo indivisible, sin nada que interfiera entre el "(" y el "*" , pero los separó.

trans-unit.source: (F) The two-character sequence "(*" in this context in a regular expression pattern should be an indivisible token, with nothing intervening between the "(" and the "*", but you separated them.

(F) The two-character sequence "(*" in this context in a regular expression pattern should be an indivisible token, with nothing intervening between the "(" and the "*", but you separated them. Fix the pattern and retry.

(F) The two-character sequence "(?" in this context in a regular expression pattern should be an indivisible token, with nothing intervening between the "(" and the "?" , but you separated them with whitespace.
trans-unit.target: (F) La secuencia de dos caracteres "(?" En este contexto en un patrón de expresión regular debe ser un símbolo indivisible, sin nada que interfiera entre el "(" y el "?" , Pero los separó con espacios en blanco.

trans-unit.source: (F) The two-character sequence "(?" in this context in a regular expression pattern should be an indivisible token, with nothing intervening between the "(" and the "?", but you separated them with whitespace.
(F) The unexec() routine failed for some reason. See your local FSF representative, who probably put it there in the first place.
trans-unit.target: (F) La rutina unexec () falló por alguna razón. Consulte a su representante local de la FSF, quien probablemente lo puso allí en primer lugar.

trans-unit.source: (F) The unpack format P must have an explicit size, not "*".
trans-unit.target: (F) El formato de descomprimir P debe tener un tamaño explícito, no "*".

trans-unit.source: (F) The yacc parser wanted to grow its stack so it could continue parsing, but realloc() wouldn't give it more memory, virtual or otherwise.
trans-unit.target: (F) El analizador yacc quería hacer crecer su pila para poder seguir analizando, pero realloc () no le daría más memoria, virtual o de otro tipo.

trans-unit.source: (F) There has to be at least one argument to syscall() to specify the system call to call, silly dilly.
trans-unit.target: (F) Tiene que haber al menos un argumento para syscall () para especificar la llamada al sistema a llamar, tonto dilly.

trans-unit.source: (F) There is a hard limit to how big a character code point can be due to the fundamental properties of UTF-8, especially on EBCDIC platforms. The given code point exceeds that. The only work-around is to not use such a large code point.
trans-unit.target: (F) Existe un límite estricto de cuán grande puede ser un punto de código de carácter debido a las propiedades fundamentales de UTF-8, especialmente en plataformas EBCDIC. El punto de código dado excede eso. La única solución es no utilizar un punto de código tan grande.

trans-unit.source: (F) There is currently a limit on the length of string which lookbehind can handle. This restriction may be eased in a future release.
trans-unit.target: (F) Actualmente existe un límite en la longitud de la cuerda que puede manejar lookbehind. Esta restricción puede aliviarse en una versión futura.

trans-unit.source: (F) There is currently a limit to the size of the min and max values of the {min,max} construct. The <-- HERE shows whereabouts in the regular expression the problem was discovered. See perlre.
trans-unit.target: (F) Actualmente existe un límite para el tamaño de los valores mínimo y máximo de la construcción {min, max}. <- AQUÍ muestra el paradero en la expresión regular donde se descubrió el problema. Ver perlre .

trans-unit.source: (F) There was a syntax error within the (?[ ]) . This can happen if the expression inside the construct was completely empty, or if there are too many or few operands for the number of operators. Perl is not smart enough to give you a more precise indication as to what is wrong.
trans-unit.target: (F) Hubo un error de sintaxis dentro de (?[ ]) . Esto puede suceder si la expresión dentro de la construcción estaba completamente vacía o si hay demasiados o pocos operandos para el número de operadores. Perl no es lo suficientemente inteligente como para darle una indicación más precisa de lo que está mal.

trans-unit.source: (F) There was a syntax error within the (?[ ]). This can happen if the expression inside the construct was completely empty, or if there are too many or few operands for the number of operators. Perl is not smart enough to give you a more precise indication as to what is wrong.
(F) There was no matching closing parenthesis for the '('. The <-- HERE shows whereabouts in the regular expression the problem was discovered.

(F) These three characters may not appear in sequence in a double-quotish context. This message is raised only on non-ASCII platforms (a different error message is output on ASCII ones). If you were intending to specify a control character with this sequence, you'll have to use a different way to specify it.
trans-unit.target: (F) Estos tres caracteres pueden no aparecer en secuencia en un contexto de comillas dobles. Este mensaje se genera solo en plataformas que no son ASCII (se emite un mensaje de error diferente en las ASCII). Si tenía la intención de especificar un carácter de control con esta secuencia, tendrá que utilizar una forma diferente de especificarlo.

trans-unit.source: (F) This attribute was never supported on my or sub declarations.
trans-unit.target: (F) Este atributo no se admite en my o sub declaraciones.

trans-unit.source: (F) This attribute was never supported on my or sub declarations.
(F) This error is likely to occur if you run a perl5 script through a perl4 interpreter, especially if the next 2 tokens are "use strict" or "my $var" or "our $var".
trans-unit.target: (F) Es probable que este error ocurra si ejecuta un script perl5 a través de un intérprete perl4, especialmente si los siguientes 2 tokens son "use estricto" o "my $ var" o "our $ var".

trans-unit.source: (F) This function requires the argument in that position to be of a certain type. Arrays must be @NAME or @{EXPR} . Hashes must be %NAME or %{EXPR} . No implicit dereferencing is allowed--use the {EXPR} forms as an explicit dereference. See perlref.
trans-unit.target: (F) Esta función requiere que el argumento en esa posición sea de cierto tipo. Las matrices deben ser @NAME o @{EXPR} . Los hash deben ser% NAME o %{EXPR} . No se permite la desreferenciación implícita; utilice los formularios {EXPR} como una desreferenciación explícita. Ver perlref .

trans-unit.source: (F) This function requires the argument in that position to be of a certain type. Arrays must be @NAME or @{EXPR}. Hashes must be %NAME or %{EXPR}. No implicit dereferencing is allowed--use the {EXPR} forms as an explicit dereference. See perlref.
(F) This machine doesn't have either waitpid() or wait4(), so only waitpid() without flags is emulated.
trans-unit.target: (F) Esta máquina no tiene waitpid () ni wait4 (), por lo que solo se emula waitpid () sin banderas.

trans-unit.source: (F) This machine doesn't implement the indicated function, apparently. At least, Configure doesn't think so.
trans-unit.target: (F) Esta máquina no implementa la función indicada, aparentemente. Al menos, Configure no lo cree así.

trans-unit.source: (F) This machine doesn't implement the select() system call.
trans-unit.target: (F) Esta máquina no implementa la llamada al sistema select ().

trans-unit.source: (F) This message indicates a bug either in the Perl core or in XS code. Such code was trying to find out if a character, allegedly stored internally encoded as UTF-8, was of a given type, such as being punctuation or a digit. But the character was not encoded in legal UTF-8. The %s is replaced by a string that can be used by knowledgeable people to determine what the type being checked against was.
(F) This message occurs when a here document label has an initial quotation mark but the final quotation mark is missing. Perhaps you wrote:
trans-unit.target: (F) Este mensaje aparece cuando la etiqueta de un documento aquí tiene una comilla inicial pero falta la comilla final. Quizás escribiste:

trans-unit.source: (F) To declare references to variables, as in my \%x, you must first enable the feature:
(F) To do aliasing via references, you must first enable the feature:
trans-unit.target: (F) Para hacer alias mediante referencias, primero debe habilitar la función:

trans-unit.source: (F) To use lexical subs, you must first enable them:
trans-unit.target: (F) Para usar subtítulos léxicos, primero debe habilitarlos:

trans-unit.source: (F) To use subroutine signatures, you must first enable them:
trans-unit.target: (F) Para usar firmas de subrutina, primero debe habilitarlas:

trans-unit.source: (F) Transliteration (tr/// and y///) transliterates individual characters. But a named sequence by definition is more than an individual character, and hence doing this operation on it doesn't make sense.

(F) Turning off the given modifier has the side effect of turning on another one. Perl currently doesn't allow this. Reword the regular expression to use the modifier you want to turn on (and place it before the minus), instead of the one you want to turn off.
trans-unit.target: (F) Desactivar el modificador dado tiene el efecto secundario de activar otro. Perl actualmente no permite esto. Reformule la expresión regular para usar el modificador que desea activar (y colóquelo antes del menos), en lugar del que desea desactivar.

trans-unit.source: (F) Unbackslashed parentheses must always be balanced in regular expressions. If you're a vi user, the % key is valuable for finding the matching parenthesis. The <-- HERE shows whereabouts in the regular expression the problem was discovered. See perlre.
trans-unit.target: (F) Los paréntesis sin barras invertidas siempre deben estar equilibrados en expresiones regulares. Si es un usuario de vi, la clave% es valiosa para encontrar el paréntesis coincidente. <- AQUÍ muestra el paradero en la expresión regular donde se descubrió el problema. Ver perlre .

trans-unit.source: (F) Unlike with "next" or "last", you're not allowed to goto an unspecified destination. See goto.
trans-unit.target: (F) A diferencia de "siguiente" o "último", no se le permite ir a un destino no especificado. Ver goto .

trans-unit.source: (F) Unlike with "next" or "last", you're not allowed to goto an unspecified destination. See "goto" in perlfunc.

(F) Using the !~ operator with s///r, tr///r or y///r is currently reserved for future use, as the exact behavior has not been decided. (Simply returning the boolean opposite of the modified string is usually not particularly useful.)
trans-unit.target: (F) El uso de la !~ Operador s///r , tr///r o y///r está reservado para uso futuro, ya que el comportamiento exacto no se ha decidido. (El simple hecho de devolver el booleano opuesto a la cadena modificada no suele ser particularmente útil).

trans-unit.source: (F) Using the !~ operator with s///r, tr///r or y///r is currently reserved for future use, as the exact behavior has not been decided. (Simply returning the boolean opposite of the modified string is usually not particularly useful.)
(F) When vec is called in an lvalue context, the second argument must be greater than or equal to zero.
trans-unit.target: (F) Cuando se llama vec en un contexto de valor l, el segundo argumento debe ser mayor o igual a cero.

trans-unit.source: (F) When vec is called in an lvalue context, the second argument must be greater than or equal to zero.
(F) When closed implicitly, the temporary file for in-place editing couldn't be renamed to the original filename.

(F) When compiling a regex pattern, an unresolved named character or sequence was encountered. This can happen in any of several ways that bypass the lexer, such as using single-quotish context, or an extra backslash in double-quotish:
trans-unit.target: (F) Al compilar un patrón de expresiones regulares, se encontró un carácter o secuencia con nombre sin resolver. Esto puede suceder de varias formas que omiten el lexer, como el uso de contexto de comillas simples o una barra invertida adicional en comillas dobles:

trans-unit.source: (F) When subroutine signatures are enabled, any subroutine attributes must come before the signature. Note that this order was the opposite in versions 5.22..5.26. So:
(F) When the "array_base" feature is disabled (e.g., and under use v5.16;, and as of Perl 5.30) the special variable $[, which is deprecated, is now a fixed zero value.
(F) When the "array_base" feature is disabled (e.g., under use v5.16; ) the special variable $[ , which is deprecated, is now a fixed zero value.
trans-unit.target: (F) Cuando la función "array_base" está deshabilitada (por ejemplo, en use v5.16; ) la variable especial $[ , que está en desuso, ahora es un valor cero fijo.

trans-unit.source: (F) When trying to initialize the random seed for hashes, Perl could not get any randomness out of your system. This usually indicates Something Very Wrong.
trans-unit.target: (F) Al intentar inicializar la semilla aleatoria para hashes, Perl no pudo obtener ninguna aleatoriedad de su sistema. Por lo general, esto indica algo muy mal.

trans-unit.source: (F) When using the sub keyword to construct an anonymous subroutine, you must always specify a block of code. See perlsub.
trans-unit.target: (F) Cuando utilice la palabra clave sub para construir una subrutina anónima, siempre debe especificar un bloque de código. Ver perlsub .

trans-unit.source: (F) When using the sub keyword to construct an anonymous subroutine, you must always specify a block of code. See perlsub.

(F) While calculating the method resolution order (MRO) of a package, Perl believes it found an infinite loop in the @ISA hierarchy. This is a crude check that bails out after 100 levels of @ISA depth.
trans-unit.target: (F) Al calcular el orden de resolución del método (MRO) de un paquete, Perl cree que encontró un bucle infinito en la jerarquía @ISA . Esta es una verificación burda que se rescata después de 100 niveles de profundidad @ISA .

trans-unit.source: (F) While certain functions allow you to specify a filehandle or an "indirect object" before the argument list, this ain't one of them.
trans-unit.target: (F) Si bien ciertas funciones le permiten especificar un identificador de archivo o un "objeto indirecto" antes de la lista de argumentos, esta no es una de ellas.

trans-unit.source: (F) While parsing an extended character class a ']' character was encountered at a point in the definition where the only legal use of ']' is to close the character class definition as part of a '])', you may have forgotten the close paren, or otherwise confused the parser.
(F) While under the use filetest pragma, switching the real and effective uids or gids failed.
trans-unit.target: (F) Mientras estaba bajo el pragma use filetest , el cambio de los uids o gids real y efectivo falló.

trans-unit.source: (F) While under the use filetest pragma, we cannot switch the real and effective uids or gids.
trans-unit.target: (F) Mientras use filetest bajo el uso de filetest pragma, no podemos cambiar los uids o gids reales y efectivos.

trans-unit.source: (F) While under the use filetest pragma, switching the real and effective uids or gids failed.
(F) While under the use filetest pragma, we cannot switch the real and effective uids or gids.
(F) While unpacking, the string buffer was already used up when an unpack length/code combination tried to obtain more data. This results in an undefined value for the length. See pack.
trans-unit.target: (F) Durante el desempaquetado, el búfer de cadena ya se había agotado cuando una combinación de longitud / código de desempaquetado intentó obtener más datos. Esto da como resultado un valor indefinido para la longitud. Ver paquete .

trans-unit.source: (F) While unpacking, the string buffer was already used up when an unpack length/code combination tried to obtain more data. This results in an undefined value for the length. See "pack" in perlfunc.
(F) With "strict subs" in use, a bareword is only allowed as a subroutine identifier, in curly brackets or to the left of the "=>" symbol. Perhaps you need to predeclare a subroutine?
trans-unit.target: (F) Con "subs estrictos" en uso, solo se permite una palabra sin formato como identificador de subrutina, entre corchetes oa la izquierda del símbolo "=>". ¿Quizás necesita declarar previamente una subrutina?

trans-unit.source: (F) Within (?[ ]) , all constants interpreted as octal need to be exactly 3 digits long. This helps catch some ambiguities. If your constant is too short, add leading zeros, like
trans-unit.target: (F) Dentro de (?[ ]) , Todas las constantes interpretadas como octales deben tener exactamente 3 dígitos de longitud. Esto ayuda a detectar algunas ambigüedades. Si su constante es demasiado corta, agregue ceros a la izquierda, como

trans-unit.source: (F) Within (?[ ]), all constants interpreted as octal need to be exactly 3 digits long. This helps catch some ambiguities. If your constant is too short, add leading zeros, like

(F) Within regular expression character classes ([]) the syntax beginning with "[." and ending with ".]" is reserved for future extensions. If you need to represent those character sequences inside a regular expression character class, just quote the square brackets with the backslash: "\[." and ".\]". The <-- HERE shows whereabouts in the regular expression the problem was discovered. See perlre.
trans-unit.target: (F) Dentro de las clases de caracteres de expresión regular ([]), la sintaxis que comienza con "[." y termina en ".]" está reservado para futuras extensiones. Si necesita representar esas secuencias de caracteres dentro de una clase de caracteres de expresión regular, simplemente cite los corchetes con la barra invertida: "\ [." y ". \]". <- AQUÍ muestra el paradero en la expresión regular donde se descubrió el problema. Ver perlre .

trans-unit.source: (F) Within regular expression character classes ([]) the syntax beginning with "[=" and ending with "=]" is reserved for future extensions. If you need to represent those character sequences inside a regular expression character class, just quote the square brackets with the backslash: "\[=" and "=\]". The <-- HERE shows whereabouts in the regular expression the problem was discovered. See perlre.
trans-unit.target: (F) Dentro de las clases de caracteres de expresión regular ([]), la sintaxis que comienza con "[=" y termina con "=]" está reservada para futuras extensiones. Si necesita representar esas secuencias de caracteres dentro de una clase de caracteres de expresión regular, simplemente cite los corchetes con la barra invertida: "\ [=" y "= \]". <- AQUÍ muestra el paradero en la expresión regular donde se descubrió el problema. Ver perlre .

trans-unit.source: (F) Wrong syntax of character name literal \N{charname} within double-quotish context. This can also happen when there is a space (or comment) between the \N and the { in a regex with the /x modifier. This modifier does not change the requirement that the brace immediately follow the \N .
trans-unit.target: (F) Sintaxis incorrecta del nombre de carácter literal \N{charname} dentro del contexto de comillas dobles. Esto también puede suceder cuando hay un espacio (o comentario) entre \N y { en una expresión regular con el modificador /x . Este modificador no cambia el requisito de que la llave de seguir inmediatamente a la \N .

trans-unit.source: (F) Wrong syntax of character name literal \N{charname} within double-quotish context. This can also happen when there is a space (or comment) between the \N and the { in a regex with the /x modifier. This modifier does not change the requirement that the brace immediately follow the \N.
(F) You are now required to use the explicitly quoted form if you wish to use an empty line as the terminator of the here-document.
(F) You aren't allowed to assign to the item indicated, or otherwise try to change it, such as with an auto-increment.
trans-unit.target: (F) No se le permite asignar el elemento indicado, o intentar cambiarlo, como con un incremento automático.

trans-unit.source: (F) You assigned a magical array to a stash element, and then tried to use the subroutine from the same slot. You are asking Perl to do something it cannot do, details subject to change between Perl versions.
trans-unit.target: (F) Asignaste una matriz mágica a un elemento de reserva y luego trataste de usar la subrutina de la misma ranura. Le está pidiendo a Perl que haga algo que no puede hacer, los detalles están sujetos a cambios entre las versiones de Perl.

trans-unit.source: (F) You assigned a reference to a scalar to $/ where the referenced item is not a positive integer. In older perls this appeared to work the same as setting it to undef but was in fact internally different, less efficient and with very bad luck could have resulted in your file being split by a stringified form of the reference.

(F) You attempted to force a different byte-order on a type that is already inside a group with a byte-order modifier. For example you cannot force little-endianness on a type that is inside a big-endian group.
trans-unit.target: (F) Intentó forzar un orden de bytes diferente en un tipo que ya está dentro de un grupo con un modificador de orden de bytes. Por ejemplo, no puede forzar little-endian en un tipo que está dentro de un grupo big-endian.

trans-unit.source: (F) You attempted to unweaken something that was not a reference. Only references can be unweakened.
(F) You attempted to use a feature of printf that is accessible from only C. This usually means there's a better way to do it in Perl.
trans-unit.target: (F) Intentó usar una función de printf a la que solo se puede acceder desde C. Esto generalmente significa que hay una mejor manera de hacerlo en Perl.

trans-unit.source: (F) You attempted to weaken something that was not a reference. Only references can be weakened.
trans-unit.target: (F) Intentaste debilitar algo que no era una referencia. Solo las referencias pueden debilitarse.

trans-unit.source: (F) You called continue, but you're not inside a when or default block.
trans-unit.target: (F) Llamaste a continue , pero no estás dentro de un bloque when o default .

trans-unit.source: (F) You called keys, values or each with a scalar argument that was not a reference to an unblessed hash or array.
trans-unit.target: (F) Llamaste a keys , values o each con un argumento escalar que no era una referencia a un hash o matriz sin bendición.

trans-unit.source: (F) You called reset('E') or similar, which tried to reset all variables in the current package beginning with "E". In the main package, that includes %ENV. Resetting %ENV is not supported on some systems, notably VMS.
trans-unit.target: (F) Usted llamó a reset('E') o similar, que intentó restablecer todas las variables en el paquete actual comenzando con "E". En el paquete principal, eso incluye% ENV. El restablecimiento de% ENV no se admite en algunos sistemas, especialmente en VMS.

trans-unit.source: (F) You called break , but you're in a foreach block rather than a given block. You probably meant to use next or last.
trans-unit.target: (F) Se llama break , pero estás en un foreach bloque en lugar de un given bloque. Probablemente quisiste usar el next o el last .

trans-unit.source: (F) You called break , but you're not inside a given block.
trans-unit.target: (F) Llamaste a break , pero no estás dentro de un bloque given .

trans-unit.source: (F) You called break, but you're in a foreach block rather than a given block. You probably meant to use next or last.
(F) You called break, but you're not inside a given block.
(F) You called continue, but you're not inside a when or default block.
(F) You called perl -x/foo/bar, but
trans-unit.target: (F) perl -x/foo/bar , pero

trans-unit.source: (F) You called perl -x , but no line was found in the file beginning with #! and containing the word "perl".
trans-unit.target: (F) Ha llamado perl -x , ¡pero no se encontró ninguna línea en el archivo que comienza con #! y que contiene la palabra "perl".

trans-unit.source: (F) You called perl -x, but no line was found in the file beginning with #! and containing the word "perl".

(F) You called reset('E') or similar, which tried to reset all variables in the current package beginning with "E". In the main package, that includes %ENV. Resetting %ENV is not supported on some systems, notably VMS.
(F) You called a POSIX function with incorrect arguments. See "FUNCTIONS" in POSIX for more information.
(F) You called a POSIX function with incorrect arguments. See FUNCTIONS in POSIX for more information.
trans-unit.target: (F) Llamaste a una función POSIX con argumentos incorrectos. Consulte FUNCIONES en POSIX para obtener más información.

trans-unit.source: (F) You called a Win32 function with incorrect arguments. See Win32 for more information.
trans-unit.target: (F) Llamaste a una función Win32 con argumentos incorrectos. Consulte Win32 para obtener más información.

trans-unit.source: (F) You called a Win32 function with incorrect arguments. See Win32 for more information.
(F) You called a method correctly, and it correctly indicated a package functioning as a class, but that package doesn't define that particular method, nor does any of its base classes. See perlobj.
trans-unit.target: (F) Usted llamó a un método correctamente e indicó correctamente un paquete que funciona como una clase, pero ese paquete no define ese método en particular, ni tampoco ninguna de sus clases base. Ver perlobj .

trans-unit.source: (F) You called a method on a class that did not exist, and the method could not be found in UNIVERSAL. This often means that a method requires a package that has not been loaded.
trans-unit.target: (F) Llamaste a un método en una clase que no existía y el método no se pudo encontrar en UNIVERSAL. Esto a menudo significa que un método requiere un paquete que no se ha cargado.

trans-unit.source: (F) You can't allocate more than 2^31+"small amount" bytes. This error is most likely to be caused by a typo in the Perl program. e.g., $arr[time] instead of $arr[$time] .
trans-unit.target: (F) No puede asignar más de 2 ^ 31 + bytes de "pequeña cantidad". Es muy probable que este error se deba a un error tipográfico en el programa Perl. por ejemplo, $arr[time] lugar de $arr[$time] .

trans-unit.source: (F) You can't allocate more than 2^31+"small amount" bytes. This error is most likely to be caused by a typo in the Perl program. e.g., $arr[time] instead of $arr[$time].
(F) You can't allocate more than 64K on an MS-DOS machine.
trans-unit.target: (F) No puede asignar más de 64K en una máquina MS-DOS.

trans-unit.source: (F) You can't pack a string by supplying a checksum, because the checksumming process loses information, and you can't go the other way. See unpack.
trans-unit.target: (F) No puede empaquetar una cadena proporcionando una suma de verificación, porque el proceso de suma de verificación pierde información y no puede ir al otro lado. Ver desembalar .

trans-unit.source: (F) You can't pack a string by supplying a checksum, because the checksumming process loses information, and you can't go the other way. See "unpack" in perlfunc.
(F) You can't quantify a quantifier without intervening parentheses. So things like ** or +* or ?* are illegal. The <-- HERE shows whereabouts in the regular expression the problem was discovered.
trans-unit.target: (F) No se puede cuantificar un cuantificador sin intervenir paréntesis. Entonces, cosas como ** o + * o? * Son ilegales. <- AQUÍ muestra el paradero en la expresión regular donde se descubrió el problema.

trans-unit.source: (F) You can't specify a repeat count so large that it overflows your signed integers. See pack.
trans-unit.target: (F) No puede especificar un recuento de repeticiones tan grande que desborde sus enteros firmados. Ver paquete .

trans-unit.source: (F) You can't specify a repeat count so large that it overflows your signed integers. See "pack" in perlfunc.

(F) You can't undefine a routine that's currently running. You can, however, redefine it while it's running, and you can even undef the redefined subroutine while the old routine is running. Go figure.
trans-unit.target: (F) No puede definir una rutina que se esté ejecutando actualmente. Sin embargo, puede redefinirlo mientras se está ejecutando, e incluso puede anular la definición de la subrutina redefinida mientras se ejecuta la rutina anterior. Imagínate.

trans-unit.source: (F) You can't use system(), exec(), or a piped open in a setuid or setgid script if $ENV{PATH} contains a directory that is writable by the world. Also, the PATH must not contain any relative directory. See perlsec.
trans-unit.target: (F) No puede usar system (), exec () o un canal abierto en un script setuid o setgid si $ENV{PATH} contiene un directorio en el que todo el mundo puede escribir. Además, la RUTA no debe contener ningún directorio relativo. Ver perlsec .

trans-unit.source: (F) You can't use system(), exec(), or a piped open in a setuid or setgid script if any of $ENV{PATH} , $ENV{IFS} , $ENV{CDPATH} , $ENV{ENV} , $ENV{BASH_ENV} or $ENV{TERM} are derived from data supplied (or potentially supplied) by the user. The script must set the path to a known value, using trustworthy data. See perlsec.
trans-unit.target: (F) No puede usar system (), exec () o un canal abierto en un script setuid o setgid si alguno de $ENV{PATH} , $ENV{IFS} , $ENV{CDPATH} , $ENV{ENV} , $ENV{BASH_ENV} o $ENV{TERM} se derivan de los datos suministrados (o potencialmente suministrados) por el usuario. El script debe establecer la ruta en un valor conocido, utilizando datos confiables. Ver perlsec .

trans-unit.source: (F) You can't use system(), exec(), or a piped open in a setuid or setgid script if any of $ENV{PATH}, $ENV{IFS}, $ENV{CDPATH}, $ENV{ENV}, $ENV{BASH_ENV} or $ENV{TERM} are derived from data supplied (or potentially supplied) by the user. The script must set the path to a known value, using trustworthy data. See perlsec.
(F) You cannot put a repeat count of any kind right after the '/' code. See pack.
trans-unit.target: (F) No puede poner un recuento de repeticiones de ningún tipo justo después del código '/'. Ver paquete .

trans-unit.source: (F) You cannot put a repeat count of any kind right after the '/' code. See "pack" in perlfunc.

(F) You defined a character name which ended in a space character. Remove the trailing space(s). Usually these names are defined in the :alias import argument to use charnames , but they could be defined by a translator installed into $^H{charnames} . See CUSTOM ALIASES in charnames.
trans-unit.target: (F) Definiste un nombre de personaje que termina en un carácter de espacio. Quite los espacios finales. Por lo general, estos nombres se definen en el argumento de importación :alias para use charnames , pero podrían ser definidos por un traductor instalado en $^H{charnames} . Consulte ALIAS PERSONALIZADAS en nombres de caracteres .

trans-unit.source: (F) You defined a character name which ended in a space character. Remove the trailing space(s). Usually these names are defined in the :alias import argument to use charnames, but they could be defined by a translator installed into $^H{charnames}. See "CUSTOM ALIASES" in charnames.

(F) You defined a character name which had multiple space characters in a row. Change them to single spaces. Usually these names are defined in the :alias import argument to use charnames , but they could be defined by a translator installed into $^H{charnames} . See CUSTOM ALIASES in charnames.
trans-unit.target: (F) Definiste un nombre de personaje que tenía varios espacios en una fila. Cámbielos a espacios simples. Por lo general, estos nombres se definen en el argumento de importación :alias para use charnames , pero podrían ser definidos por un traductor instalado en $^H{charnames} . Consulte ALIAS PERSONALIZADAS en nombres de caracteres .

trans-unit.source: (F) You defined a character name which had multiple space characters in a row. Change them to single spaces. Usually these names are defined in the :alias import argument to use charnames, but they could be defined by a translator installed into $^H{charnames}. See "CUSTOM ALIASES" in charnames.
(F) You don't have System V message IPC on your system.
trans-unit.target: (F) No tiene el mensaje IPC del Sistema V en su sistema.

trans-unit.source: (F) You don't have System V semaphore IPC on your system.
trans-unit.target: (F) No tiene IPC de semáforo System V en su sistema.

trans-unit.source: (F) You don't have System V shared memory IPC on your system.
trans-unit.target: (F) No tiene IPC de memoria compartida System V en su sistema.

trans-unit.source: (F) You either made a typo or have incorrectly put a * quantifier after an open brace in your pattern. Check the pattern and review perlre for details on legal verb patterns.
trans-unit.target: (F) O cometió un error tipográfico o colocó incorrectamente un * cuantificador después de una llave abierta en su patrón. Verifique el patrón y revise perlre para obtener detalles sobre los patrones de verbos legales.

trans-unit.source: (F) You had a (sub-)template that ends with a '/'. There must be another template code following the slash. See pack.
trans-unit.target: (F) Tenías una (sub) plantilla que termina con una '/'. Debe haber otro código de plantilla después de la barra. Ver paquete .

trans-unit.source: (F) You had a (sub-)template that ends with a '/'. There must be another template code following the slash. See "pack" in perlfunc.
(F) You had a (un)pack template that specified a relative position before the beginning of the string being (un)packed. See pack.
trans-unit.target: (F) Tenías una plantilla de (des) paquete que especificaba una posición relativa antes del comienzo de la cadena que se (des) empaquetaba. Ver paquete .

trans-unit.source: (F) You had a (un)pack template that specified a relative position before the beginning of the string being (un)packed. See "pack" in perlfunc.
(F) You had a pack template that specified a relative position after the end of the string being unpacked. See pack.
trans-unit.target: (F) Tenía una plantilla de paquete que especificaba una posición relativa después del final de la cadena que se desempaqueta. Ver paquete .

trans-unit.source: (F) You had a pack template that specified a relative position after the end of the string being unpacked. See "pack" in perlfunc.
(F) You had a template that specified an absolute position outside the string being unpacked. See pack.
trans-unit.target: (F) Tenía una plantilla que especificaba una posición absoluta fuera de la cadena que se estaba desempaquetando. Ver paquete .

trans-unit.source: (F) You had a template that specified an absolute position outside the string being unpacked. See "pack" in perlfunc.
(F) You had a template that specified an absolute position outside the string being unpacked. The string being unpacked was also invalid UTF-8. See pack.
trans-unit.target: (F) Tenía una plantilla que especificaba una posición absoluta fuera de la cadena que se estaba desempaquetando. La cadena que se estaba desempaquetando también era UTF-8 no válida. Ver paquete .

trans-unit.source: (F) You had a template that specified an absolute position outside the string being unpacked. The string being unpacked was also invalid UTF-8. See "pack" in perlfunc.
(F) You had an unpack template indicating a counted-length string, but you have also specified an explicit size for the string. See pack.
trans-unit.target: (F) Tenía una plantilla de desempaquetar que indica una cadena de longitud contada, pero también ha especificado un tamaño explícito para la cadena. Ver paquete .

trans-unit.source: (F) You had an unpack template indicating a counted-length string, but you have also specified an explicit size for the string. See "pack" in perlfunc.
(F) You had an unpack template that contained a '/', but this did not follow some unpack specification producing a numeric value. See pack.
trans-unit.target: (F) Tenía una plantilla de desempaquetado que contenía una '/', pero esto no siguió alguna especificación de desempaquetado que produjera un valor numérico. Ver paquete .

trans-unit.source: (F) You had an unpack template that contained a '/', but this did not follow some unpack specification producing a numeric value. See "pack" in perlfunc.
(F) You had something like this:
trans-unit.target: (F) Tenías algo como esto:

trans-unit.source: (F) You have an indented here-document where one or more of its lines have whitespace at the beginning that does not match the closing delimiter.
(F) You have configured Perl to use long doubles but the internals of the long double format are unknown; therefore the hexadecimal float output is impossible.
trans-unit.target: (F) Ha configurado Perl para usar dobles largos, pero se desconocen los aspectos internos del formato doble largo; por lo tanto, la salida flotante hexadecimal es imposible.

trans-unit.source: (F) You have exceeded the number of open "(" parentheses that haven't been matched by corresponding closing ones. This limit prevents eating up too much memory. It is initially set to 1000, but may be changed by setting ${^RE_COMPILE_RECURSION_LIMIT} to some other value. This may need to be done in a BEGIN block before the regular expression pattern is compiled.

(F) You have used a default block that is neither inside a foreach loop nor a given block. (Note that this error is issued on exit from the default block, so you won't get the error if you use an explicit continue.)
